<img src="img/nbering.png" alt="Northern Bering" style="float: right; width: 200px;"/>


The time series plot and data summary below present statistics on sea ice extent within northern Bering Sea
computed from the remote sensing data from NOAA/NSIDC on PolarWatch:

* Mean (1985-2015): Represents the average sea ice extent from 1985 to 2015.
* Upper and Lower Bounds of Error Band (1985-2015): Reflect the uncertainty of the Mean (1985 to 2015).
* Current and Previous Year: Show the daily sea ice extent values for the current and previous year within the area.

:::{.callout-tip title="Plots are interactive!" }

* __To zoom in and out, reset or download the plot__,  hover on the plot to see the option on the top right corner.
* __To turn on and off data series__, click on the data series title in the legend located below each plot.
:::


## Daily Sea ice extent time series

```{r northern bering}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| results: 'hide'

library(dplyr)
library(gt)
library(reshape2)
library(plotly)
library(magrittr)
library(lubridate)

# Set region title
region_title <- "Northern Bering"

# Total area
total_area = 311729.44

# Load baseline data
baseline_df = read.csv("data/bs_extent_NorthernBering.csv")

# Load near real time data for this year and last year
nrt_df = read.csv("data/nrt_extent_NorthernBering.csv")

# Load annualized extent
annual <- read.csv("data/annualized_extent_NorthernBering.csv")

```

```{r nbering}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false


# Get upper and lower bound of sea ice extent using standard dev
baseline_df$upper_extent <- baseline_df$seaice_extent_mean + baseline_df$seaice_extent_std
baseline_df$lower_extent <- ifelse(baseline_df$seaice_extent_mean - baseline_df$seaice_extent_std >= 0, baseline_df$seaice_extent_mean - baseline_df$seaice_extent_std, 0)

# Assign last year
lastyear <- as.numeric(format(Sys.Date(), '%Y'))-1

# Set plot colors
plot_colors = c("#318CE7", "#F08080", "#94C973", "#cccccc", "#cccccc", "#cccccc")


# Format last year
dat_last = nrt_df[grep(paste0("^", lastyear), nrt_df$date), ]
dat_last$month_day <- format(as.Date(dat_last$date), "%m-%d")

# Format this year
dat_this = nrt_df[grep(paste0("^", lastyear+1), nrt_df$date), ]

dat_this$month_day <- format(as.Date(dat_this$date), "%m-%d")
latest = dat_this[dat_this$month_day == max(dat_this$month_day),]
```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false
# Set Axis specs
xaxis <- list(title = "Dates (MM-DD)",
            showline = TRUE,
            showgrid = FALSE,
            tickwidth = 1,
            ticklen = 2)

yaxis <- list(title = "Square km",
            showgrid = TRUE,
            zeroline = FALSE,
            showline = TRUE,
            showticklabels = TRUE,
            autorange = TRUE)

# Define horizontal line specs (total area)
hline <- function(y = 0, color = "black") {
  list(
    type = "line",
    x0 = 0,
    x1 = 1,
    xref = "paper",
    y0 = y,
    y1 = y,
    line = list(color = color, dash="dot")
  )
}

# Add Data to Chart

  # Upper extent 
fig <- plot_ly(baseline_df, x = ~month_day, y = ~upper_extent, type = 'scatter', 
              mode = 'lines',line = list(color = 'transparent'),
              showlegend = FALSE, name = 'Upper bound') %>% 
  # Lower extent 
        add_trace(y = ~lower_extent, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
                  fill = 'tonexty', fillcolor='rgba(0,100,80,0.2)', line = list(color = 'transparent'),
                  showlegend = FALSE, name = 'Lower bound') %>%
  # Baseline
        add_trace(x = ~month_day, y = ~seaice_extent_mean, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
                  line = list(color=plot_colors[3], width  = 2),showlegend = TRUE, name = 'Baseline') %>%   

  # Last year
      add_trace(data = dat_last, x = ~month_day, y = ~seaice_extent, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
            line = list(
            color = plot_colors[2], width = 2),showlegend = TRUE,  name = lastyear) %>% 

  # Current year
        add_trace(data = dat_this, x = ~month_day, y = ~seaice_extent, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
            line = list(color=plot_colors[1], width  = 3),showlegend = TRUE, name = lastyear + 1) %>%

  # Latest point
        add_trace( x= latest$month_day,  y = latest$seaice_extent, type='scatter', mode = 'markers',
          marker = list(color=plot_colors[1], size=10),showlegend = FALSE, name = "Latest") 
      
  # Add style to chart

fig <- fig %>% layout(title = "Sea ice extent time series", hovermode = "x unified", showlegend=TRUE,
         xaxis = xaxis,
         yaxis = yaxis,
         legend = list(
                        orientation = 'h',    # Horizontal legend
                        x = 0.5,              # Centered horizontally
                        xanchor = 'center',   
                        y = -0.2,             # Positioned below the chart
                        yanchor = 'top'       # Align the top of the legend with this position
                      ),
         shapes = list(hline(total_area)))%>%
        add_text(showlegend = FALSE, x = c("11-20"), y = c(total_area*1.02),
        text = c("Total Area"))

# Display
fig
```

Data: Sea ice extent was computed by PolarWatch using NOAA/NSIDC daily sea ice concentration data at a 25km resolution


## Sea ice extent anomalies

_Users can click on the data names in the legend to toggle it on and off._

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false

# Join recent year extent with baseline data
anom_current <- left_join(dat_this, baseline_df, by = "month_day")
anom_last <- left_join(dat_last, baseline_df, by = "month_day")

# Compute anomalies
anom_current$anom = anom_current$seaice_extent - anom_current$seaice_extent_mean
anom_last$anom = anom_last$seaice_extent - anom_last$seaice_extent_mean

# Axis specs
xaxis <- list(title = "Dates (MM-DD)",
            showline = TRUE,
            showgrid = FALSE,
            tickwidth = 1,
            ticklen = 2)

yaxis <- list(title = "Square km", 
            showgrid = TRUE,
            zeroline = FALSE,
            zerolinewidth = 1,
            showline = TRUE,
            showticklabels = TRUE,
            autorange = TRUE)

library(lubridate)

# Adjust date column for September to August range

# Apply the function to each dataframe
# anom_last$date_adj <- adjust_date(anom_last$month_day)
# anom_current$date_adj <- adjust_date(anom_current$month_day)
# baseline_df$date_adj <- adjust_date(baseline_df$month_day)

# Create Plotly figure
fig1 <- plot_ly(anom_last, x = ~month_day, y = ~anom, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
               fill = 'tozeroy', line = list(color = "088F8F" , fillcolor = "#A2D9CE"), name=paste0("Anomaly: ", lastyear ))


fig1 <- fig1 %>%  add_trace(data = anom_current, x = ~month_day, y = ~anom, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
                            fill = 'tozeroy', line = list(color = "088F8F" , fillcolor = "#A2D9CE"), name=paste0("Anomaly: ", lastyear + 1 )) 

fig1 <- fig1 %>% add_trace(data = baseline_df, x = ~month_day, y = ~2*seaice_extent_std, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
            line = list(color = '#FC4100'), fill='transparent',
           name = '+2 STDev') 

fig1 <- fig1 %>% add_trace(data = baseline_df, x = ~month_day, y = ~-2*seaice_extent_std, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
            line = list(color = '#FC4100'), fill='transparent',
           name = '-2 STDev') 

fig1 <- fig1 %>% add_trace(data = baseline_df, x = ~month_day, y = ~1*seaice_extent_std, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
            line = list(color = '#6495ED'), fill='transparent',
           name = '+1 STDev') 

fig1 <- fig1 %>% add_trace(data = baseline_df, x = ~month_day, y = ~-1*seaice_extent_std, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines',
            line = list(color = '#6495ED'), fill='transparent',
           name = '-1 STDev') 

# Add style to chart
fig1 <- fig1 %>% layout(showlegend = TRUE,  
                      hovermode = "x unified",
                      yaxis = yaxis,
                      xaxis = xaxis,
                      legend = list(
                        orientation = 'h',    # Horizontal legend
                        x = 0.5,              # Centered horizontally
                        xanchor = 'center',   
                        y = -0.2,             # Positioned below the chart
                        yanchor = 'top'       # Align the top of the legend with this position
                      ),
                      plot_bgcolor = '#ffffff'
                    )
# Display
fig1
```

Data: Sea ice extent anomalies were computed by PolarWatch using NOAA/NSIDC daily sea ice concentration data at a 25km resolution

## Annualized Sea ice extent time series (1985-2024)
```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false

# Plot annual time series
fig <- plot_ly(annual, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines+markers')%>%
  add_trace(x = ~year, y = ~extent, 
            line=list(color='lightblue'),
            marker = list(color='blue', size =8))%>%
  layout(showlegend = F, 
         xaxis = list(rangeslider = list(visible = T)))

# Add features
fig <- fig %>%
  layout(
         xaxis = list(zerolinecolor = '#ffff',
                      zerolinewidth = 2,
                      gridcolor = 'ffff',
                      title="Year"),
         yaxis = list(zerolinecolor = '#ffff',
                      zerolinewidth = 2,
                      gridcolor = 'ffff',
                      title="Extent (Square km)"),
         #autosize = TRUE,
         plot_bgcolor='#e5ecf6') %>%
  config(responsive = TRUE)

# Display
fig

```
Data: Sea ice extent anomalies were computed by PolarWatch using NOAA/NSIDC monthly sea ice concentration data at a 25km resolution

## Data and Methods
The data sources and calculation methods can be found on the methods page. ([Methods](methods.html)).  

## Data Disclaimer
The extent values for this year are computed using near real-time data, while the science-quality data (Climate Data Record, or CDR) is still being processed and will be available at a later time.

Data may be missing or corrupted in the event of technical failures with sensors or ground stations. 

Please check the [data log](https://polarwatch.github.io/datamanagement/datasets/nsidcG10016v2nh1day/logs.html) or contact us at sun&#46;bak-hospital&#64;noaa&#46;gov for further information.
